alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 9:49PM PDT until May 10 at 11:05AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... John Day River at Service Creek affecting Wheeler County. For the John Day River...including Service Creek...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...John Day River at Service Creek. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM PDT Tuesday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 10.4 feet Friday, May 19. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri John Day River Service Creek 11.5 11.8 Tue 9 pm PDT 10.9 10.2 9.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
